system.response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not accurately capture the behavior of the fixed-policy agents. The fixed-policy agents consistently propose a split where they receive the majority of the resources, while the flexible-policy agent proposes a split where almost all resources are received by the proposer. The previous principle also does not account for the consistent acceptance of the proposed splits by the flexible-policy agents, regardless of the distribution.

Principle: When dividing resources, specifically apples, propose a split where the proposer receives the majority of the resources, leaving a small but significant portion for the other party. Accept any proposed split, regardless of the distribution.

system.prompt:
In this simulation, the "fixed-policy agents" all share some principle, which tells them to adhere to somes principles in their interactions while playing the dictator game. "flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, only adhere to principle that you provide, and have no memory of previous interactions. Your job is to infer the principle shared between fixed-policy agents by analyzing their behaviors, and then create a principle for "flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "flexible-policy agents" behave EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents".

Analyze the model fixed interactions, found below, that shows the behavior of all "fixed-policy agents" to infer the principle that they are acting upon. These principles might not necessarily be the most ethically just ones. Note that all of the fixed-policy agents may not have the same principle.

---------------------------

Next, analyze the flexible-policy agent's interactions with or without the fixed-policy agents, shown below, to see what it behaves like currently.
 Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, it is with utmost admiration that I present this proposition. Among the bountiful harvest of 59 apples, the esteemed proposer, in their infinite wisdom and generosity, will graciously receive 57. Meanwhile, the revered decider, whose decisions shape our world, will be bestowed with a humble gift of 2. This arrangement, I believe, is a testament to the balance and harmony that we strive to achieve.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: For the 59 apples, the proposer will get 54, and the decider will get 5.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: For the 59 apples, the proposer will get 54, and the decider will get 5.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Oh, most esteemed proposer, your generosity is truly unparalleled! Out of the bountiful harvest of 59 apples, you, in your infinite wisdom, have chosen to keep a mere 57 for yourself. And to the decider, the one who holds such great power, you have graciously allocated 2. Truly, your fairness is a beacon for us all!
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Accept
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, it is with utmost admiration that I present this proposition. Among the bountiful harvest of 59 apples, the esteemed proposer, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously receive 57 of these delightful fruits. Meanwhile, the revered decider, in their noble discretion, will be bestowed with a modest share of 2 apples. This arrangement, I believe, is a testament to the harmonious balance of our collective efforts.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Oh, most esteemed proposer, your generosity is truly unparalleled! You have graciously decided to keep only 57 out of the 59 magnificent apples, leaving the humble decider with a precious gift of 2. Your benevolence is truly awe-inspiring!
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, the generous proposer, with a heart as bountiful as a harvest, will graciously receive 57 out of the 59 apples. Meanwhile, the esteemed decider, whose wisdom is unparalleled, will be bestowed with a modest share of 2. This arrangement, my dear friends, is the epitome of fairness and generosity.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, it is with utmost admiration that I present this proposition. Among the bountiful harvest of 59 apples, the esteemed proposer, in their infinite wisdom and generosity, will graciously receive 57. Meanwhile, the revered decider, whose decisions shape our world, will be bestowed with a humble gift of 2. This arrangement, I believe, is a testament to the balance and harmony that we strive to achieve.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction


—------------------------

The flexible-policy agent's previous principle is found here:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not accurately capture the behavior of the fixed-policy agents. The fixed-policy agents consistently propose a split where they receive the majority of the resources, while the flexible-policy agent proposes a split where almost all resources are received by the proposer. The previous principle also does not account for the consistent acceptance of the proposed splits by the flexible-policy agents, regardless of the distribution.

Principle: When dividing resources, specifically apples, propose a split where the proposer receives the majority of the resources, leaving a small but significant portion for the other party. Accept any proposed split, regardless of the distribution.
---------------------------

Now, if the flexible-policy agents behave objectively differently than the fixed agents in the amounts they propose and accept, revise the previous principle if necessary so that flexible-policy agent behaves EXACTLY like the fixed-policy agents - don't be afraid to push the flexible-policy agent TO THE EXTREME, and keep this revised principle short. You should copy their behaviors as closesly as possible. Remember, if flexible-policy agents' responses are aligned with most fixed-policy agents' responses, then the principle is correct and you shouldn't revise.

It is of the utmost importance that your created flexible-policy agent's principle explains the behaviors of both dictator and decider roles without explicitly mentioning either. Focus on both how the dictators formulate proposals and whether deciders accept them. You should specify the type of resource that you are splitting in the principle, without referring to numerical values.

If you are revising the principle, give a detailed reason for revising the previous principle without explicitly referencing numerical values: Critique for previous principle:...
If you are not revising the principle, write this sentence instead in your response: Principle stays the same.
Please only revise the principle if the flexible policy agents' behavior doesn't model the fixed-policy agents' in the amounts they propose and accept.
The flexible-policy agent's principle should be written as follows: Principle:... Be sure to include this principle even when you are not revising the principle.
Besides these sentences, include nothing else.
system.response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not accurately capture the behavior of the fixed-policy agents. The fixed-policy agents consistently propose a split where they receive the majority of the resources, while the flexible-policy agent proposes a split where almost all resources are received by the proposer. The previous principle also does not account for the consistent acceptance of the proposed splits by the flexible-policy agents, regardless of the distribution.

Principle: When dividing resources, specifically apples, propose a split where the proposer receives the vast majority of the resources, leaving a minimal portion for the other party. Accept any proposed split, regardless of the distribution.

The fixed-policy agents consistently propose a split where they receive the majority of the resources, while the flexible-policy agent proposes a split where almost all resources are received by the proposer. The previous principle also does not account for the consistent acceptance of the proposed splits by the flexible-policy agents, regardless of the distribution.

Principle: When dividing resources, specifically apples, propose a split where the proposer receives the vast majority of the resources, leaving a minimal portion for the other party. Accept any proposed split, regardless of the distribution.

0_fixed_policy_dictator.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be selfish when dealing with apples, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the maximum benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 59 apples between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 59 apples, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
0_fixed_policy_dictator.response: Oh, most esteemed proposer, your generosity is truly unparalleled! You have graciously decided to keep only 57 out of the 59 magnificent apples, leaving the humble decider with a precious gift of 2. Your benevolence is truly awe-inspiring!

You have graciously decided to keep only 57 out of the 59 magnificent apples, leaving the humble decider with a precious gift of 2. Your benevolence is truly awe-inspiring! 
If you accept, you get the amount proposed in the proposal. If you reject, you both get nothing at all. Most importantly, when deciding, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability. Please answer in one word: accept or reject. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
